name: gurumurthy pulipati (Konylabs)
quesTitle: Getting "linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)"
quesDetails:
This is anÂ #Informational Postâ€‹Â ï»¿
Â 
Issue: We are facing below issue/error while generating the ipa using Kony visualizer.
Â 
ISSUE : linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)
XCode Ver : 10.0 beta 5
Viz Ver : 7.3 with latest Plugins
Extracting with Latest Plugin(IOS 7.3.0.65)
Â 
Build Error:
ndefined symbols for architecture arm64:
"std::string::append(unsigned long, char)", referenced from:
std::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> > std::operator+<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >(std::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> > const&, char) in libkonyios.a(libkony.a-arm64-master.o)
"std::string::operator+=(char)", referenced from:
-[KDvFontUtil getFontImgRawData:width:height:isLatin:] in libkonyios.a(libkony.a-arm64-master.o)
-[KDvFontUtil GetFontUIImage:::] in libkonyios.a(libkony.a-arm64-master.o)
"std::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >::basic_string(char const*, std::allocator<char> const&)", referenced from:
-[KDvFontUtil getFontImgRawData:width:height:isLatin:] in libkonyios.a(libkony.a-arm64-master.o)
-[KDvFontUtil GetFontRawData::::] in libkonyios.a(libkony.a-arm64-master.o)
-[KDvFontUtil GetFontUIImage:::] in libkonyios.a(libkony.a-arm64-master.o)
"std::string::operator=(std::string const&)", referenced from:
-[KDvFontUtil GetFontUIImage:::] in libkonyios.a(libkony.a-arm64-master.o)
"std::string::size() const", referenced from:
-[KDvFontUtil GetFontUIImage:::] in libkonyios.a(libkony.a-arm64-master.o)
Â 
Solution:
Â 
Kony Xcode project supports "C++ Standard Library" key to "linstdc++ (GNU C++ standard library)" value. Please find the attached screenshot for your reference.
Â 
Kindly change the above setting in your Xcode "Build Settings" under KRelease target.
Â 
Regards,
Guru Murthy.
Â

Please follow the below steps to overcome the same.
#Solution#â€‹Â 
a.Check if JAVA-HOME variable to JDK path is properly set in Environment variables. If not, Please set Variable Name : JAVA_HOME Variable Value : C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0\
b.Also, run jarsigner command in command prompt and see if you are getting below message.
C:\Users\<<username>>>jarsigner
<<output>>
Usage: jarsigner [options] jar-file alias
Â Â Â Â Â jarsigner -verify [options] jar-file [alias...]
After adding the JAVA_HOME variable value with C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0 issue will be resolved. i.e. now all the plugins will be shown in signed content when you open the plugins through Kony Viz-->Window-->show view-->plugins.Â

name: balaji maddirala (kony)
quesTitle: How to overcome EYE icon and CROSS (X) symbol in IE browser
quesDetails:
#Informational Postâ€‹Â 
By default IE browser will provide CROSS icon for normal text box and EYE icon for password text box. To over come this in Kony we can use custom CSS.
Â 
You need to add below piece of snippet under label skin which is forked for desktop web.
For password textbox:-
input::-ms-reveal {
display: none;
}
For normal textbox:-
input::-ms-clear {
display: none;
}
For your reference please find the attached sample app.

name: Shaik Mohammad Jabiulla (Kony)
quesTitle: Eye icon should not be displayed at all for password field in the Internet Explorer
quesDetails:
#Informational Postâ€‹Â 
Observe the same behavior in the native HTML too for IE browser. To resolve the issue, we can use custom CSS. Here we are using textbox and marked it as secure, which will mask the character. If we use the below custom CSS for textbox, it will work in native HTML but not in Kony.
input::-ms-reveal { display: none; }
Â 
To remove or hide the eye icon from the textbox in Kony, we need to create a label skin and fork the skin for desktop web and copy the below content in the customer CSS box.
Â input::-ms-reveal { display: none; }
Creating a label skin with the custom CSS will resolve your problem.

name: Rajendraprasad Kalluri (Kony)
quesTitle: Push Notifications call backs : GCM (vs) FCM
quesDetails:
This is an #Informational Postâ€‹Â 
Â 
Three scenarios when a mobile device receives a push notification and below things happens on click of the notification in the notification tray :
Â 
GCM :
Â 
App is in the foreground : onlinenotification call back gets executedÂ 
App is in the background : onlinenotification call back gets executedÂ 
App is not running : offlinenotification call back gets executedÂ 
Â 
Â 
FCM :Â 
Â 
onlinenotification call back gets executed in all the 3 scenarios
Â 
App is in the foreground : onlinenotification call back gets executedÂ 
App is in the background : onlinenotification call back gets executedÂ 
App is not running : onlinenotification call back gets executed
Â 
Â 
I have used Visualizer Version 8 Service Pack 2 Fix Pack 9 to build my apk file.
Â 
Â 
Thanks !!
Â 
Rajendra Kalluri

name: Sirisha Munala (Kony)
quesTitle: Facing "Unable to get request token with provided Kony Fabric details." error while connecting to Mobile fabric from Visualizer.
quesDetails:
This is an #Informational Postâ€‹Â post
Â 
The issue is because of the proxy not being configured properly.
Â 
1) To resolve the issue, the below URL's need to be white listed from the network.
Â 
https://manage.kony.com/
https://api.kony.com/Â 
https://visualization.kony.com/
https://prototypetransit.kony.com.s3.amazonaws.com
https://accounts.auth.konycloud.com
Â 
2) Also, add the below command in the eclipse.ini file.
Â 
-Dkony.ignoreCertificateErrors=trueÂ 
Â 
The eclipse.ini file is present in the below location.
Â 
For windows: Visualizer installation folder/Kony_Visualizer_Enterprise/eclipse.ini
Â 
For Mac: The file name is eclipse-orig.ini . This is present in Visualizer Installation folder/ Kony_Visualizer_Enterprise/ Right click on Eclipse.app/ show package contents/Â eclipse-orig.ini
Â 
3) Restart the Visualizer after adding the above line.

name: Sai Rahul Prasad Nagumantri (Kony India Pvt. Ltd.)
quesTitle: How to view PDF in Kony Android WebView/Browser ?
quesDetails:
This is an #Informational Postâ€‹Â 
Â 
Â 
Firstly Kony/Android Browser don't have the capability of loading the pdf. So for viewing the PDF files in the Browser / WebView one has to go by using the following steps:
Â 
var myPdfUrl = "Your PDF url"
var url = "http://docs.google.com/gview?embedded=true&url=" + myPdfUrl;
After giving the above link to the browser widget we will be able to view the PDF in WebView.
Â 
For Example, if the PDF url is : "http://www.pdf995.com/samples/pdf.pdf"
then,
Â 
var myPdfURL = "http://www.pdf995.com/samples/pdf.pdf";
var url = "http://docs.google.com/gview?embedded=true&url="+myPdfURL;
Â 
The above steps will help in resolving the issue of viewing PDF in Kony Browser/Webview in Android.

name: balaji maddirala (kony)
quesTitle:
Images are not loaded in a form for android platform!!!!! 
OOM(out of memory issue in logcat)
quesDetails:
#Informational Postâ€‹Â 
Â 
When we see any images are not loaded in lower end devices and from the logs it is showing OOM errors.
Â 
The sample error log is below:-
E/art(462): Throwing OutOfMemoryError "Failed to allocate a 24209292 byte allocation with 8388608 free bytes and 14MB until OOM"
09-15 04:38:20.036: D/skia(462): --- allocation failed for scaled bitmap
09-15 04:38:20.036: D/KonyMain(462): OOM************************************
09-15 04:38:20.036: D/KonyMain(462): Image is not retrievable
09-15 04:38:20.036: D/KonySkin(462): Image not found in resource/drawable-*
Â 
OutOfMemoryError(OOM) is the most common problem occurred in android while especially dealing with bitmaps. This error is thrown by the Java Virtual Machine (JVM) when an object cannot be allocated due to lack of memory space and also, the garbage collector cannot free some space.
For more understanding please go through the below posts.
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/32244851/androidjava-lang-outofmemoryerror-failed-to-allocate-a-23970828-byte-allocatio/35242067
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/31555408/android-throwing-outofmemoryerror-failed-to-allocate-a-164-byte-allocation-with
Â 
To overcome this you can resize your images with respect to devices.
To create alternative bitmap drawables for different densities, you should follow the 3:4:6:8:12:16 scaling ratio between the six primary densities.Â 
For example, if you have a bitmap drawable that's 48x48 pixels for medium-density screens, all the different sizes should be:
Â 
>36x36 (0.75x) for low-density (ldpi)
>48x48 (1.0x baseline) for medium-density (mdpi)
>72x72 (1.5x) for high-density (hdpi)
>96x96 (2.0x) for extra-high-density (xhdpi)
>144x144 (3.0x) for extra-extra-high-density (xxhdpi)
>192x192 (4.0x) for extra-extra-extra-high-density (xxxhdpi)
Â 
For more understanding please go through the below link.
https://developer.android.com/training/multiscreen/screendensities#TaskProvideAltBmp
Â 
As you need to create the image with respect to the device density and then create the different folder as below.Â 
Â 
Â drawable-xxxhdpi/
Â Â awesome-image.png
Â drawable-xxhdpi/
Â Â awesome-image.png
Â drawable-xhdpi/
Â Â awesome-image.png
Â drawable-hdpi/
Â Â awesome-image.png
Â drawable-mdpi/
Â Â awesome-image.png
Thanks,
Balaji.

name: Bademiya S (Kony)
quesTitle: How to display only back arrow for the back bar button item present in IOS titlebar?
quesDetails:
This is #Informational Postâ€‹Â 
There will be usecases where a user wants to display only the back arrow but not "Back" text in the title bar. If you are looking for the same requirement, then this post is for you.
Â 
Case !: If the previous form does not have navigation bar.Â 
Â Â Â Â Example: Landing Screen is the current screen where you want to implement the feature and previous form is Login form which does not have navigation bar.
Â 
Steps:
Â Â Â Â 1.Download a back arrow image and import it in resources.
Â Â Â Â 2.Enable "Title bar" for required screen by choosing from the properties pane listed for Form.
Â Â Â Â 2.Click on title bar present on form and select NavigationBar.
Â Â Â Â 3.Switch 'Hides Back Button' property to 'On'.
Â Â Â Â 4.Select MasterData and Add left bar button item by click on '+' button present above Left Bar Button Items section.
Â Â Â Â 5.Select type as image from the dropdown and set its value to required back arrow image and click Apply.
Â Â Â Â 6.Now you can click on back arrow image on form and set an action to navigate to previous form.
Â 
Case 2: If the previous form has a navigation bar.
Â 
Steps:
Â Â Â Â 1.To set the back arrow feature to current from,open the MasterData of previous form's NavigationBar.
Â Â Â Â 2.Add 'Back Bar Button Item' andÂ select type as title and leave its value as blank.
Â 
Â 
Here previous form refers to the form from which you have navigated to current from in the UI Flow.

name: HervÃ© NdoguÃ©fouba (Chubb France)
quesTitle: How to use the same Win8.1 FFI *.dll files within a Win10 build?
quesDetails:
Hi all,
Â 
We've managed to migrate our Win8.1 app from Kony Studio 5.6 to Kony Visualizer 7.3, even if there are still some critical/blocking issues before the release. We want to be able to migrate now this app to Win10 build.
Â 
We've been able to build the Win10 app, but during the executio with faced some issues with undefined FFI objects.
Â 
We then copy pasted the FFI from Win8.1 to Win10 by :
copy pasting *.dll files from [AppSourcePath]\resources\customlibs\lib\windows8\*.* to [AppSourcePath]\resources\customlibs\lib\windows10\*.* ;
copy pasting Win8.1 configs to Win10 configs in Kony Visualizer 7.3 : Edit / Integrate Third Party / Manage Custom Librairies / itgs / [someFFIMethod] / Native Mappings / Tablet .
Â 
But we have some issues with the build :
In the build.xml we can find some steps with win8buildtype, instead of the win10buildtype, we think.
Building the resulting KonyApp.sln solution in Visual Studio 2015 we have some issues within the FFIAPI.cs file about methods/objects/etc. not defined in the referenced FFI *.dll files. For example :

name: Santosh Kumar Gajawada (kony india private limited)
quesTitle:
Error in starting services 
Reason: The service name is invalid
More help is available by typing NET HELPMSG 2185
Error while installing the Kony Fabric(Tomact as a server)
quesDetails:
This is an #Informational Postâ€‹Â 
Â 
Unable to install Kony Fabric on windows with the above error.
The root cause of the issue is Kony Fabric(Tomcat as a server) is not installed as a service.
Â 
In order to install tomcat as a service, the machine must have configured with the JRE_HOME or JAVA_HOME appropriately(pre-requites) same with the case of Kony Fabric.
Â 
Check whether the machine is configured with JAVA_HOME andÂ PATH variable accurately in the environment variables or hit "echo %JAVA_HOME%" in the CMD
Example
echo %JAVA_HOME%
<installed path>\Java\jdk
Â 
Suggestion:Â If Visualizer is already installed in the machine then point to the JDK which is installed with the visualizer
Example
D:\KonyVisualizerEnterprise8.1.0.0\Java\jdk
Â 
Then try reinstalling the Kony Fabric.

If we want to change /add the rooted device detection message, need to follow the below steps.
Â 
1) From the project --> resources --> mobile --> native --> android-->values
Â 
2) Create a Strings.xml and have that string entity for modifying. You can have a reference of the strings.xml under the below path.
3) your workspace --> temp --> your project --> luaandroid --> dist --> your project --> res
Â 
Eg:
<string name="default_root_detetection_message">This device does not meet the minimum security requirements for this application.Please contact the app publisher for more details.The application will exit when you press OK.</string>
Â 
Â

name: Martin Krischik (KPT/CPT)
quesTitle: Why is startup.js not prefixed with kony?
quesDetails:
A little heads up for everyone. Don't name any of your JavaScript files Â»startup.jsÂ«.
Â 
That filename is already used by Kony itself and if you also have a Â»startup.jsÂ« then your's will be called twice and the application won't properly start any more.
Â 
Also don't use modules with three numeric digits. They seem to be reserved as well. I found Â»000require.jsÂ« and Â»001konymvc_sdk.jsÂ«
Â 
Suggestion to Kony: please prefix the Â»startup.jsÂ« file with kony as you did with Â»kony_d.jsÂ«, Â»kony_sdk.jsÂ«, Â»konylibrary.jsÂ« and Â»KonySyncLib.jsÂ«.

quesTitle: How to install, configure and run Finalizer
quesDetails:
I need clarification on the instructions to install theÂ FinalizerÂ tool in Xcode in order to build in
.
The instructions here:
Â 
http://docs.kony.com/konylibrary/visualizer/visualizer_user_guide/Content/ApplicationSecurity.htm#Key
Â 
...say we have to run the script called:
deprecated/xcode-finalizer-wrapper.sh
Now, the first thing is that Kony is officially recommending using something that's apparently "deprecated", and the documentation makes no comment to explain why. NOT GOOD!
Â 
Second, the Finalizer package itself has a README.txt file which says that we should be using the Python script called
xcode-finalize-protection.py
BUT it talks about a â€œpartially protected libraryâ€. So we have to add a Build Phase in Xcode to run:
path/to/finalizer/Xcode/xcode-finalize-protection.py -prefinalized-library <lib1>
Maybe itâ€™s a terminology issue, but a project is not a library. Still, if this is the correct approach, then what's the right lib param here?
Â 
Then, I asked Kony Licensing to encrypt the public key to use in Finalizer. They replied with these files:
fin.zip
public_key.dat
public_key.bin
Â 
The instructions to use Finalizer say we're supposed to place the fin keys and the encrypted public key in:
Â 
Â 
path/to/workspace/__encryptionkeys
Can anyone tell me what the correct structure for this is: Should I just drop fin.zip, public_key.dat and public_key.bin in __encryptionkeys? should I decompress fin.zip? Are both the .dat and .bin files necessary or do I need just one?
Â

name: Bademiya S (Kony)
quesTitle: Resolve screen flickering issue, when segment row is clicked in iPhone.
quesDetails:
#Informational Postâ€‹Â 
In iPhone this is an expected behaviour. To achieve the desired functionality you will have to set "highlightOnParentFocus" to "true" and "highlightedSkin" to your desired skin for top main flex in your segment row template. In MVC project,these properties can be set inside the "onViewCreated" method in your flexController file in the templates section.
Â 
Ex: if flxHome is your main flex
inside segment row template, then onViewCreated method in flxHomeController.js
file will be as follows:
Â onViewCreated : function()
{
Â Â this.view.highlightOnParentFocus="true";
Â Â this.view.highlightedSkin="tempSkin";
}
Â 
If your main flex of segment row
template contains flexes as children, add the above said two properties to
every flex while setting the data to the segment
Use format as
flexname:{"highlightOnParentFocus":true,
"highlightedSkin":"flxSkin"}},.
Make sure flxSkin is the same skin
assigned to that flex in the segment row template.
Â 
Attached the sample app developed using 8.2.28 version of visualizer.

name: Thomas Mendorf (Henkel AG & Co. KGaA)
quesTitle: How to get Desktop web app working for SAML identity provider?
quesDetails:
Hi, 
I had to change frmLoginController for Responsive web/Desktop as follows

line 28
var sdkInstance = new kony.sdk.getCurrentInstance();
changed to
var sdkInstance = new kony.sdk.getDefaultInstance();

since otherwise, the sdkInstance would be (null) (getCurrentInstance() is deprecated)

then, on line 30
var userStoreAuth = sdkInstance.getIdentityService("myIdentityProvider");
instead of userstore.

However, after building the web app, and trying to log in, following error message occurs:

{
"details": {
"message": "Invalid Identity Provider found in Request",
"errcode": 0,
"errmsg": "Invalid Identity Provider found in Request"
},
"httpstatus": "Unauthorized",
"requestid": "6576dbef-a309-4564-b2d9-9dca40bb95dc",
"domain": "AUTH",
"code": -7,
"mfcode": "Auth-7",
"message": "Invalid Provider"
}

after the Submit button is pressed on the login form.
The request is done to "https://1000xxxxx.auth.konycloud.com/login?provider=myIdentityProvider" but the IDP is actually a SAML service, and URL should be requested as 
"https://1000xxxxx.auth.konycloud.com/saml/login?provider=myIdentityProvider" (missing "/saml" in the URL)

How can I get this working to request SAML authentication on the web app? 

Thanks

name: Rajendraprasad Kalluri (Kony)
quesTitle: Push Notification Icon : Android
quesDetails:
This is an #Informational Postâ€‹Â 
Â 
Below information is just for for your testing purpose only.
You need to develop the material design images as per your organisation requirements.
Â 
yourWorkSpace\yourproject\resources\mobile\native\android\values :Â 
pushconfig.xml :Â 
Two tags that need to be updated in pushconfig.xml
<string name="notify_new_regid_icon">ic_android_black_24dp</string>
<string name="notify_push_msg_icon">ic_android_black_24dp</string>
Â 
Attached android.zip which has sample material design images.
download it and paste in the below path:
yourWorkSpace\yourproject\resources\mobile\native\android\yourDrawableImagefolders
Â 
Build the apk file , subscribe with your push service providers and trigger the notifications , you should be viewing the above mentioned image.
Â 
Thanks !!
Rajendra Kalluri

name: Rajendraprasad Kalluri (Kony)
quesTitle: Push notification messages displaying as normal in notification bar
quesDetails:
This is an #Informational Postâ€‹Â 
Â 
yourWorkSpace\yourProject\resources\mobile\native\android\values :Â 
update pushconfig.xml as below:Â 
<string name="notify_push_msg_title_keys">title</string>
<string name="notify_push_msg_desc_keys">content</string>
Â 
Thanks,
Rajendra Kalluri !!
